cd.author: Farrah Gray
cd.text: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.

cd.author: Confucius
cd.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.

cd.author: Audrey Hepburn
cd.text: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.

cd.author: Anne Frank
cd.text: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.

cd.author: Priscilla Presley
cd.text: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.

cd.author: Ivana Trump
cd.text: Gorgeous hair is the best revenge.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.

cd.author: Buddha
cd.text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection

cd.author: Lucille Ball
cd.text: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.

cd.author: Brigham Young
cd.text: Why should we worry about what others think of us, do we have more confidence in their opinions than we do our own?

cd.author: Helen KellerB17
cd.text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the face

cd.author: Louise L. Hay
cd.text: You have been criticizing yourself for years, and it hasn’t worked. Try approving of yourself and see what happens.

cd.author: Johnny Depp
cd.text: I think everybody’s weird. We should all celebrate our individuality and not be embarrassed or ashamed of it.

cd.author: Aristotle
cd.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act but a habit.

cd.author: Steve Jobs
cd.text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.

cd.author: Frank Sinatra
cd.text: The best revenge is massive success.

cd.author: Albert Einstein
cd.text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: We are still masters of our fate. We are still captains of our souls.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Motivation alone is not enough.If you have an idiot and you motivate him,now you have a motivated idiot.

cd.author: John F. Kennedy
cd.text: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.

cd.author: C. S. Lewis
cd.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

cd.author: Ted Turner
cd.text: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.

cd.author: John F. Kennedy
cd.text: If not us, who? If not now, when?

cd.author: Walt Disney
cd.text: All our dreams can come true – if we have the courage to pursue them.

cd.author: Donald Trump
cd.text: If you’re going to be thinking, you may as well think big.

cd.author: Abraham Lincoln
cd.text: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.

cd.author: Thomas Edison
cd.text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.

cd.author: Aristotle
cd.text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.

cd.author: Dolly Parton
cd.text: We cannot direct the wind but we can adjust the sails

cd.author: Mahatma Gandhi
cd.text: We must become the change we want to see.

cd.author: Confucius
cd.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us

cd.author: John Maxwell
cd.text: Life is 10% of what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it.

cd.author: Max Lucado
cd.text: You change your life by changing your heart.

cd.author: Thomas A. Edison
cd.text: If we did the things we are capable of, we would astound ourselves.

cd.author: Theodore Roosevelt
cd.text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.

cd.author: Ronald Reagan
cd.text: We can’t help everyone, but everyone can help someone.

cd.author: Robert H. Schuller
cd.text: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?

cd.author: Pablo Picasso
cd.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.

cd.author: Abraham Lincoln
cd.text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.

cd.author: Dale Carnegie
cd.text: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.

cd.author: J. Paul Getty
cd.text: Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil.

cd.author: Michael Jordan
cd.text: I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.

cd.author: Thomas A. Edison
cd.text: Many of life’s failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

cd.author: William Shakespeare
cd.text: To climb steep hills requires slow pace at first.

cd.author: Virgil
cd.text: They can because they think they can.

cd.author: Robert Collier
cd.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.

cd.author: Malcolm S. Forbes
cd.text: Victory is sweetest when you’ve known defeat

cd.author: Mark Twain
cd.text: To succeed in life, you need two things: ignorance and confidence.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well

cd.author: Aristotle
cd.text: He who has never learned to obey cannot be a good commander.

cd.author: Proverbs 29:18
cd.text: Where there is no vision, the people perish.

cd.author: Kenneth Blanchard
cd.text: The key to successful leadership today is influence, not authority.

cd.author: Abraham Lincoln
cd.text: No man is good enough to govern another man without that other’s consent

cd.author: Edgar R. Fiedler
cd.text: Ask five economists and you’ll get five different answers – six if one went to Harvard.

cd.author: Robin Williams
cd.text: Carpe per diem – seize the check

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.

cd.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
cd.text: True love is like ghosts, which everybody talks about and few have seen.

cd.author: Robert Louis Balfour Stevenson
cd.text: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.

cd.author: Muhammed Ali.
cd.text: The man who views the world at 50 the same as he did at 20 has wasted 30 years of his life.

cd.author: Zig Ziglar
cd.text: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.

cd.author: Robert Frost
cd.text: By working faithfully eight hours a day, you may eventually get to be a boss and work twelve hours a day

cd.author: Ethel Barrymore
cd.text: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh — at yourself.

cd.author: Tom Lehrer
cd.text: Life is like a sewer… what you get out of it depends on what you put into it.

cd.author: Dale Carnegie
cd.text: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.

cd.author: James Allen
cd.text: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.

cd.author: Henry Ellis
cd.text: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.

cd.author: William James
cd.text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.

cd.author: Buddha
cd.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

cd.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
cd.text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

cd.author: John D. Rockefeller
cd.text: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.

cd.author: Aristotle
cd.text: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.

cd.author: Dale Carnegie
cd.text: Remember happiness doesn’t depend upon who you are or what you have; it depends solely on what you think.

cd.author: Timothy Dwight
cd.text: The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts.

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.

cd.author: Rose Lane
cd.text: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don’t even remember leaving open.

cd.author: George Orwell
cd.text: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness

cd.author: Mahatma Gandhi
cd.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference

cd.author: Lao Tzu
cd.text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be

cd.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
cd.text: Take the first step in faith. You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.

cd.author: Napoleon Hill
cd.text: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, the mind can achieve.

cd.author: Oprah Winfrey
cd.text: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.

cd.author: Mahatma Gandhi
cd.text: A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes.

cd.author: Zig Ziglar
cd.text: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

cd.author: Robert H. Schuller
cd.text: It takes but one positive thought when given a chance to survive and thrive to overpower an entire army of negative thoughts.

cd.author: Zig Ziglar
cd.text: When you put faith, hope and love together, you can raise positive kids in a negative world

cd.author: Napoleon Hill
cd.text: Don’t wait. The time will never be just right

cd.author: Zig Ziglar
cd.text: If you wait until all the lights are “green” before you leave home, you’ll never get started on your trip to the top.

cd.author: William Shakespeare
cd.text: In delay there lies no plenty.

cd.author: Anne Frank
cd.text: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.

cd.author: Robert Schuller
cd.text: Yes, you can be a dreamer and a doer too, if you will remove one word from your vocabulary: impossible.

cd.author: Dale Carnegie
cd.text: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.

cd.author: Master Yoda
cd.text: Do or do not do. There is no try.

cd.author: Steve Jobs
cd.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.

cd.author: Albert Einstein
cd.text: Problems cannot be solved by the same level of thinking that created them.

cd.author: Oscar Wilde
cd.text: The imagination imitates. It is the critical spirit that creates.

cd.author: Pablo Picasso
cd.text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up

cd.author: Earl Nightingale
cd.text: Creativity is a natural extension of our enthusiasm.

cd.author: Henry David Thoreau
cd.text: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.

cd.author: Sean Connery
cd.text: You write your first draft with your heart and you re-write with your head. The first key to writing is to write, not to think.

cd.author: Albert Einstein
cd.text: Creativity is contagious. Pass it on.

cd.author: Benjamin Franklin
cd.text: If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.

cd.author: Donald Trump
cd.text: Without passion you don’t have energy, without energy you have nothing

cd.author: Bill Cosby
cd.text: Anyone can dabble, but once you’ve made that commitment, your blood has that particular thing in it, and it’s very hard for people to stop you.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: Passion, though a bad regulator, is a powerful spring.

cd.author: George Bernard Shaw
cd.text: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.

cd.author: John Powell
cd.text: Communication works for those who work at it.

cd.author: Anthony Robbins
cd.text: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.

cd.author: Lao Tzu
cd.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.

cd.author: Bruce Barton
cd.text: Talkers have always ruled. They will continue to rule. The smart thing is to join them

cd.author: Mark Twain
cd.text: If you have nothing to say, say nothing.

cd.author: Mark Twain
cd.text: One learns peoples through the heart, not the eyes or the intellect.

cd.author: Mark Twain
cd.text: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.

cd.author: James Humes
cd.text: The art of communication is the language of leadership.

cd.author: Stephen King
cd.text: The most important things are the hardest to say, because words diminish them.

cd.author: Ernest Hemingway
cd.text: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Effective communication is 20% what you know and 80% how you feel about what you know.

cd.author: Mother Teresa
cd.text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.

cd.author: John Marshall
cd.text: To listen well is as powerful a means of communication and influence as to talk well.

cd.author: Plato
cd.text: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.

cd.author: Kevin Kruse
cd.text: Life is about making an impact, not making an income.

cd.author: Albert Einstein
cd.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.

cd.author: Robert Frost
cd.text: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.

cd.author: Florence Nightingale
cd.text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.

cd.author: Wayne Gretzky
cd.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.

cd.author: Amelia Earhart
cd.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.

cd.author: Babe Ruth
cd.text: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.

cd.author: W. Clement Stone
cd.text: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.

cd.author: Kevin Kruse
cd.text: Life isn’t about getting and having, it’s about giving and being.

cd.author: John Lennon
cd.text: Life is what happens to you while you’re busy making other plans.

cd.author: Earl Nightingale
cd.text: We become what we think about.

cd.author: Charles Swindoll
cd.text: Life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it.

cd.author: Alice Walker
cd.text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.

cd.author: Buddha
cd.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

cd.author: Socrates
cd.text: An unexamined life is not worth living.

cd.author: Woody Allen
cd.text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

cd.author: Steve Jobs
cd.text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.

cd.author: Vince Lombardi
cd.text: Winning isn’t everything, but wanting to win is.

cd.author: Stephen Covey
cd.text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.

cd.author: Christopher Columbus
cd.text: You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: A bird doesn't sing because it has an answer, it sings because it has a song.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: A wise woman wishes to be no one's enemy; a wise woman refuses to be anyone's victim.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.

cd.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
cd.text: Whatever you can do, or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it.

cd.author: Anais Nin
cd.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.

cd.author: George Santayana
cd.text: Those who do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it.

cd.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
cd.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

cd.author: Andrew Carnegie
cd.text: People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents.

cd.author: Benjamin Franklin
cd.text: The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results.

cd.author: Katherine Whitehorn
cd.text: Find out what you like doing best and get someone to pay you for doing it.

cd.author: Arthur Ashe
cd.text: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.

cd.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
cd.text: Big jobs usually go to the men who prove their ability to outgrow small ones.

cd.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
cd.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.

cd.author: Author Unknown
cd.text: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.

cd.author: Audrey Hepburn
cd.text: Opportunities don’t often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.

cd.author: Brian Tracy
cd.text: Never say anything about yourself you do not want to come true.

cd.author: Marva Collins
cd.text: Success doesn’t come to you, you go to it.

cd.author: Robert F. Kennedy
cd.text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.

cd.author: Author Unknown
cd.text: Never tell me the sky’s the limit when there are footprints on the moon.

cd.author: George Eliot
cd.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.

cd.author: Walt Disney
cd.text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

cd.author: Brian Tracy
cd.text: Every experience in your life is being orchestrated to teach you something you need to know to move forward.

cd.author: Abraham Lincoln
cd.text: Whatever you are, be a good one.

cd.author: Walt Disney
cd.text: If you dream it, you can do it.

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: Never, never, never give up.

cd.author: Pablo Picasso
cd.text: Everything you can imagine is real.

cd.author: Simone Weil
cd.text: I can, therefore I am.

cd.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
cd.text: Remember no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

cd.author: Oprah Winfrey
cd.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

cd.author: Confucius
cd.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

cd.author: Theodore Roosevelt
cd.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.

cd.author: Aristotle
cd.text: Hope is a waking dream.

cd.author: Pablo Picasso
cd.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.

cd.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
cd.text: You must do the thing you think you cannot do.

cd.author: Ray Bradbury
cd.text: Life is trying things to see if they work.

cd.author: Ben Ipock
cd.text: Don’t regret the past, just learn from it.

cd.author: Theodore Roosevelt
cd.text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.

cd.author: Jo Deurbrouck
cd.text: Live what you love.

cd.author: John Muir
cd.text: The power of imagination makes us infinite.

cd.author: Jonathan Swift
cd.text: May you live every day of your life.

cd.author: Wilson Kanadi
cd.text: To be the best, you must be able to handle the worst.

cd.author: Buddha
cd.text: A jug fills drop by drop.

cd.author: Zen Proverb
cd.text: The obstacle is the path.

cd.author: Robert Frost
cd.text: The best way out is always through.

cd.author: Michelle Horst
cd.text: Hope is the heartbeat of the soul.

cd.author: Samuel Beckett
cd.text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.

cd.author: Confucius
cd.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

cd.author: Earl Nightingale
cd.text: We become what we think about.

cd.author: Prescott Bush
cd.text: An obstacle is often a stepping stone.

cd.author: Norman Vaughan
cd.text: Dream big and dare to fail.

cd.author: Henry David Thoreau
cd.text: Men are born to succeed, not fail.

cd.author: Rumi
cd.text: If all you can do is crawl, start crawling.

cd.author: Kyle Chandler
cd.text: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.

cd.author: Thomas Edison
cd.text: If we did the things we are capable of, we would astound ourselves.

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: There is no man living that can not do more than he thinks he can.

cd.author: Alexis Carrel
cd.text: Man cannot remake himself without suffering for he is both the marble and the sculptor.

cd.author: Ayn Rand
cd.text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.1

cd.author: Marilyn Vos Savant
cd.text: Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.

cd.author: Walter Bagehot
cd.text: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

cd.author: Robert Brault
cd.text: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.1

cd.author: Norman Vincent Peale
cd.text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

cd.author: Jim Rohn
cd.text: If you don’t like how things are, change it! You’re not a tree.

cd.author: Miranda Kerr
cd.text: We all have bad days, but one thing is true; no cloud is so dark that the sun can’t shine through.

cd.author: Bruce Lee
cd.text: Don’t fear failure, in great attempts it is glorious even to fail.

cd.author: Beverly Sills
cd.text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.

cd.author: Maya Angelou
cd.text: You will face many defeats in your life, but never let yourself be defeated.

cd.author: John Atkinson
cd.text: If you don’t run your own life, somebody else will.

cd.author: Dalai Lama
cd.text: Learn the rules so you know how to break them properly.

cd.author: William James
cd.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

cd.author: Will Rogers
cd.text: Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.

cd.author: Wallace Stegner
cd.text: Be proud of every scar on your heart, each one holds a lifetimes worth of lessons.

cd.author: Miguel de Cervantes
cd.text: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.

cd.author: Winston Churchill
cd.text: You have enemies? Good. That means you’ve stood up for something, sometime in your life.

cd.author: Ralph Marston
cd.text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.

cd.author: John Ruskin
cd.text: The highest reward for a person’s toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.

cd.author: Tom Bodett
cd.text: The difference between an optimist and a pessimist? An optimist laughs to forget but a pessimist forgets to laugh.

cd.author: Walt Whitman
cd.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine and shadows will fall behind you.

cd.author: Chinese Proverb
cd.text: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.

cd.author: Henry David Thoreau
cd.text: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.

cd.author: Bruce Lee
cd.text: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.

cd.author: Hellen Keller
cd.text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.

cd.author: Arthur C. Clark
cd.text: The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.

cd.author: Mark Cuban
cd.text: The only thing in your control is effort. That’s all, and that’s everything.

cd.author: C.S. Lewis
cd.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

cd.author: Rita Mae Brown
cd.text: I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself.

cd.author: W.E.B. Du Bois
cd.text: There is in this world no such force as the force of a man determined to rise

cd.author: Lao Tse
cd.text: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty.

cd.author: E.E. Cummings
cd.text: It takes courage to grow up and turn out to be who you really are.

cd.author: Marilyn Monroe
cd.text: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it’s better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.

cd.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
cd.text: And when you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.

cd.author: Seneca
cd.text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

cd.author: Mother Teresa
cd.text: Do small things with great love.

cd.author: Veronica Roth
cd.text: Sometimes crying or laughing are the only options left, and laughing feels better right now.

cd.author: John Wooden
cd.text: Do not let what you can’t do interfere with what you can do.

cd.author: Judy Garland
cd.text: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.

cd.author: Unknown
cd.text: Success consists of doing the common things of life uncommonly well.

cd.author: Roy L. Goodman
cd.text: Remember that happiness is a way of travel, not a destination.

cd.author: Nelson Mandela
cd.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

cd.author: Jim Beggs
cd.text: To find fulfillment…don’t exist with life – embrace it.

cd.author: Rumi
cd.text: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?

cd.author: C.S.Lewis
cd.text: Experience is a brutal teacher, but you learn. My God, do you learn.

cd.author: Wayne W. Dyer
cd.text: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.

cd.author: Travis Wynn
cd.text: Setbacks are opportunities for major comebacks.

cd.author: Muhammad Ali
cd.text: It’s not the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it’s the pebble in your shoe.

cd.author: Zig Ziglar
cd.text: A goal property set is halfway reached.

cd.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
cd.text: Little by little, one travels far.

cd.author: Audrey Hepburn
cd.text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’!

cd.author: Dale Carnegie
cd.text: All life is a chance. So take it! the person who goes furthest is the one who is willing to do and dare.

cd.author: William Shakespeare
cd.text: Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt.

cd.author: Jared Leto
cd.text: Try and fail, but never fail to try.

cd.author: Eric Mangini
cd.text: Each day you must choose, the pain of discipline or the pain of regret.

cd.author: Erich Fromm
cd.text: Man’s main task is to give birth to himself.

cd.author: Bruce Lee
cd.text: Long-term consistency trumps short-term intensity.

cd.author: Henry Ford
cd.text: Whether you think you can or think you can’t, you’re right.

cd.author: Brian Tracy
cd.text: It doesn’t matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.

cd.author: Walt Whitman
cd.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine, and shadows will fall behind you.

cd.author: Benjamin Franklin
cd.text: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.

cd.author: Oprah
cd.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

cd.author: Pablo Picasso
cd.text: Inspiration does exist, but it must find you working.

cd.author: Thomas Paine
cd.text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.

cd.author: Japanese Proverb
cd.text: The person who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

cd.author: Vince Lombardi
cd.text: The only time success comes before work is in the dictionary.

cd.author: Jean Houston
cd.text: We all have the extraordinary coded within us, waiting to be released.

cd.author: Stephanie Barron
cd.text: When a quiet man is moved to passion, it seems the very earth will shake.

cd.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
cd.text: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.

cd.author: Seneca
cd.text: Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbor he is making for, no wind is the right wind.

cd.author: Arthur Golden
cd.text: Adversity is like a strong wind. It tears away from us all but the things that cannot be torn, so that we see ourselves as we truly are.

cd.author: Tupac
cd.text: If you can’t find something to live for, you best find something to die for.

cd.author: Rebekah L. Pierce
cd.text: Impatience is the thief of success.

cd.author: Fight Club
cd.text: No fear. No distractions. The ability to let that which does not matter truly slide.

cd.author: Henry David Thoreau
cd.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

cd.author: Ayn Rand
cd.text: The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me.

cd.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
cd.text: Life is a journey, not a destination. It is only with the heart that one can see rightly. What is essential is invisble to the eye.

cd.author: Tupac
cd.text: You gotta find a way to survive cause they win when your soul dies.

cd.author: Buddha
cd.text: The trouble is you think you have time.

cd.author: Ariana Medina
cd.text: The thing about motivation is that you don’t really find it finds you.

cd.author: Madonna
cd.text: No matter who you are, no matter what you did, no matter where you’ve come from, you can always change and become a better version of yourself.

cd.author: Minna Thomas Antrim
cd.text: Three failures denote uncommon strength. A weakling has not enough grit to fail thrice.

cd.author: Drina Reed
cd.text: If you want something you never had, you’ve got to do something you’ve never done.

cd.author: Old Sufi saying
cd.text: If you don’t know where you are going any road will get you there

cd.author: unknown
cd.text: Everything is okay in the end, if it’s not ok, then it’s not the end.

cd.author: Apple, Inc.
cd.text: People who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do.

cd.author: Lao Tzu
cd.text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

cd.author: Brian Tracy
cd.text: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, ‘What’s in it for me?’

cd.author: Vincent Van Gogh
cd.text: If you hear a voice within you say “you cannot paint,” then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.

cd.author: Robert Collier
cd.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
